revised_title: Magnetic Inequalities: A Comparison of Diurnal Ranges at Toronto and Kew
tldr: This article compares the diurnal ranges of magnetic declination at Toronto and Kew, analyzing the differences in phase between the magnetic inequalities at both locations. The study finds that the phases of magnetic inequalities occur at Toronto nearly two days before the advent of the corresponding phases at Kew, indicating a progression of magnetic weather from west to east.
